arm_group.description: Patients undergoing surgery with xenon-based general anesthesia

brief_summary.textblock:
The purpose of this study is to establish a laboratory method to determine from blood
      samples whether a person has been treated with xenon.

clinical_study.brief_title: Development of a Mass-spectometry Based Method for Detecting Xenon Application in Humans

detailed_description.textblock:
The noble gas xenon is used for general anesthesia in clinical routine. Recent reports
      indicate that xenon is also used for increasing performance in high-performance sports. The
      purpose of this study is to establish a method for detecting xenon exposure in humans.

      In patients undergoing surgery with xenon anesthesia as part of routine hospital care, small
      blood samples (3ml) will be taken before anesthesia, during anaesthesia and at 4, 8 and 14
      hours after anesthesia. These blood samples will be analyzed for traces of xenon.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Age of 18 years and older

          -  Xenon-based anesthesia as part of routine care

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Inability to give written informed consent

          -  Known pregnancy

          -  Hemoglobin concentration of less than 12g/dl

study_pop.textblock:
Patients undergoing xenon-based general anesthesia as part of routine care at University
        Hospital Düsseldorf, Germany

intervention.intervention_name: Anesthesia with inhalative application of xenon gas

clinical_study.official_title: Development of a Mass-spectometry Based Method for Detecting Xenon Application in Humans
